goal.ch: 組織工程是一門跨領域學科，將工程原理融合生命科學知識，應用在修補、維持或改善組織功能的各式生物替代物的開發中。再生醫學結合了組織工程學和生物材料技術，可以完成細胞，組織或器官的修復過程。對於人類而言，我們再生治療的最終目標是開發功能全面的生物工程器官，以替代因疾病，損傷或衰老而丟失或受損的器官。但是，到目前為止，還沒有完善的技術來實現功能正常的器官的3D重建。此外，在2019年，美國環境保護署（EPA）指示該機構積極減少動物試驗，包括減少哺乳動物的研究要求，並在2025年之前將資助減少30％，並在2035年之前完全消除它們。動物替代已成為一個緊迫而關鍵的問題。在本課程中，我們將介紹組織工程學和再生醫學的基礎，還將討論如何開發體外測試平台，以結束對傳統動物測試作為人類和環境風險預測指標的數十年依賴。
goal.en: (英文) Tissue engineering is an interdisciplinary field that applies the principles of engineering and the life sciences toward the development of biological substitutes that restore, maintain, or improve tissue function. Regenerative medicine combines tissue engineering and biomaterial technology performing the process for cells, tissues or organs repair. For human beings, our ultimate goal of regenerative therapy is to develop fully functioning bioengineered organs that can replace lost or damaged organs following disease, injury, or aging. However, until now, there exists no consummate technology to achieve 3D reconstructions of fully functioning organs. Besides, in, 2019, U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) directs the agency to aggressively reduce animal testing, including reducing mammal study requests and funding 30% by 2025 and completely eliminating them by 2035. How to create a reliable and appropriable alternative test model for animal substitution has become an urgent and crucial issue. In this class, we will introduce the basis of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine, also we will discuss how to developing in-vitro test platform for ending decades of reliance on conventional animal tests as predictors of risk to humans and our environment.
